intro: Acetosella hernandesii, commonly known as the Canary Islands sorrel, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, acute leaves and clusters of pink or white flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the mild, humid climate of its native habitat. It is often found in open areas such as grasslands and slopes, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
